Just as the sky is not harmed by spears and swords,
Bodhisattvas observe suffering, but have no anxious thoughts.
Just as the sky rains sweet dew, but the sky has no joy,
Bodhisattvas do not give rise to defiled and attached thoughts towards fame and profit.
Praise and slander do not move the sky, suffering and joy the mind is always still;
Although the great earth may shake, the nature of the sky always abides.
Bodhisattvas, with regard to worldly dharmas, are free from discriminating thoughts;
Just as the sky is not burned by fire, bodhisattvas are not defiled by afflictions.
The sky is free from arising and ceasing, the dharma realm has no coming and going;
Various forms appear in the sky, all dharmas abide in the mind.
Empty, formless, and not form, the nature of the mind is also thus;
Space is only a provisional name, and so are the mind, consciousness, and thought.
Just as space is boundless, the virtues of the wise are like this;
Like a trace in the sky is difficult to accomplish, the practice of enlightenment is without characteristics.
Space has no beginning, and the nature of the five aggregates is also thus;
The past and present four great emptinesses, and the future are also like this.
Just as the burnt world-realm is difficult to fill for all beings,
The five desires flowing into the mind, difficult to fill, are also like this.
The Buddha speaks the great Dharma phrases, leaving desire and transcending the world;
The teachings are vast and boundless, like space, with nothing to be obtained.
Understanding the true Dharma, the nature is neither destroyed nor abides;
Knowing the nature is itself non-nature, right view abides in reality.
The nature of sound is empty and non-existent, and the nature of speech is also thus;
The essence of dharmas is originally without words, without sound, and without explanation.
All dharmas are like illusions, flames, dreams, shadows, and echoes, all empty;
Tranquil and without compare, guiding, therefore using analogies.
Dharmas without characteristics are explained as characteristics, both the able and the characterized are non-existent;
Bodhisattvas understand suchness, like space, with nothing to attain.
Without attachment, without existence, without awareness, without conceptual proliferation;
Not liberating sentient beings, as the nature is for bodhisattvas.
Sentient beings are originally in nirvana, hearing this without fear;
Wearing the armor of bravery, called abiding in bodhi.
Just like an illusionist, harming many illusory beings;
In reality there is nothing to harm, liberating beings is also like this.
Illusory transformations and sentient beings, the Buddhadharma is also like this;
If one realizes the same nature, the nature of no inherent nature.

Sentient beings and space, the mind of enlightenment and the Buddha Dharma.
